corpname.value: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives

p.value: Donated by Ernest Erber in circa 2004; additional materials were donated by Elena Erber in 2010. The accession number associated with these gifts is 2004.033.

In his later life Erber was a distinguished urban and regional planner, working mostly in northern New Jersey.  He continued his political involvement as a member of the Democratic Socialist Organizing Committee and then of  Democratic Socialists of America.  He and his wife, Sylvia, lived during most of their retirement years in Red Hook, NY; he died in New York City in 2009.

The collection contains extensive files of both incoming and outgoing correspondence. Notable correspondents include Maurice Isserman, Nancy MacDonald, James T. Farrell, Gordon Haskell, Irving Weinstein, Irving Howe, Michael Harrington, Charles Orr and Herbert Reid, among many others. The collection also includes manuscripts and internal bulletins relating to the Workers Party, the Young People's Socialist League, DSOC and DSA; accounts of U.S. Socialist involvement in the Spanish Civil War and of Erber's visit to Spain in 1937; drafts of Erber's unpublished autobiography; a typescript memoir by Gordon Haskell; Erber's statement on resigning from the Workers Party and Max Shachtman's reply (with associated correspondence); and general files relating to Erber's work as a planner and his many historical/political interests.
